Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores or maximum hit points is ended.
The target's lifespan is increased by {@dice 1d4} years. A creature can only gain this benefit once in its lifetime.

entries: Any water removed from the blessed pool loses these benefits, though it is clean, safe to drink, and has a pleasant mineral taste.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th-level or higher, the water remains blessed for 1 year. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the water is blessed until the spell is dispelled.

spell.name: Whaleoil
entries: You transform the flesh of a creature you can see within range into burning fuel. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} necrotic damage and ignites in flames. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't set ablaze. While ablaze, the target sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. At the start of each of the target's turns, it and each creature within 10 feet of it takes {@damage 2d10} fire damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.
If you target a creature without flesh, such as an ooze, iron golem, or skeleton, the spell fails.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, both the necrotic and fire damage increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Whirlpool Slash

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You swing a weapon with the force of a whirlpool. Each creature within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward you. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you can make a melee attack with a weapon at each creature that is pulled within 5 feet of you. If both you and the target are standing on or submerged in a body of water, you have advantage on the attack roll.

feat.name: Cannoneer
entries: Your familiarity with {@object ballista|DMG|ballistas}, {@object cannon|DMG|cannons}, and other heavy mounted weaponry grants you the following benefits:

items: You can load, aim, or fire a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} as a bonus action on your turn.
When a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} you loaded deals damage, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total.
When a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} that you aimed is fired, you can add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll.
When you fire a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon}, attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the ranged weapon attack roll.
If you spend 1 minute repairing a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon}, it regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your level.

feat.name: Conductive Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct lightning spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell create or destroy water|PHB} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot or providing material components. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
When you cast a spell using hydromancy, you can treat any bodies of water that are less than 10 feet apart at any point as a single body of water.
When you cast a spell that deals lightning damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.

Once per turn when you deal lightning damage to a creature with a spell cast using hydromancy, you can cause it to take an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage, or {@damage 1d12} lightning damage if the creature is submerged in water.

feat.name: Expert Fisherman
entries: Experienced in the behavior and motions of aquatic prey, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence (Nature), Wisdom (Animal Handling), and Wisdom (Survival) checks made when interacting with aquatic creatures.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to spot creatures and phenomena underwater.
When you make an attack at a target that is submerged in water on your turn in combat, you can use a bonus action to steady your aim in order to gain advantage on the attack roll.
If you are proficient with nets, you can add your proficiency bonus to the DC for the Strength check required to free a creature from a net you threw.

feat.name: Fanatical Devotion
entries: Your intense worship and piety grant you the following benefits:

items: When you create a {@creature kuo-toa idol} using God Making, it remains for 8 hours instead of 1 hour, and is created with a number of temporary hit points equal to your level.

While you are within 10 feet of your {@creature kuo-toa idol} and can see  it, you have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and can't be {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

feat.name: Heavy Carapace
entries: Your carapace hardens and grows more dense, granting you the following benefits:

items: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws made against effects that would push you or knock you {@condition prone}.
Your pincers gain the heavy property, and you can deal bludgeoning or slashing damage (your choice) equal to {@damage 1d8} + your Strength modifier when you hit with them.

feat.name: Rime Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct your hydromancy through ice and snow, and to direct cold spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell water walk|PHB} spell and cast it once without expending a spell slot or providing material components. When you cast the spell in this way, it is only capable of targeting yourself, only allows you to move across the surface of liquid water, and leaves shards of ice in your wake. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
You can treat a body of snow or ice as a body of water when casting spells with the hydromancy tag.
When you cast a spell that deals cold damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.
While you are fully submerged in water, you have resistance to cold damage.

feat.name: Steam Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct your hydromancy spells through water vapor, and to direct fire spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell fog cloud|PHB} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
You can treat an area of fog, mist, or steam as a body of water when casting spells with the hydromancy tag.
When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.
Fire damage dealt by spells you cast using hydromancy ignores resistance granted from being underwater.

feat.name: Sure-Footed
entries: Experienced with shifting terrain or the rocking and swaying of ships out at sea, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

When a creature within 5 feet of you fails an ability check or saving throw against an effect that would knock it {@condition prone}, you can use your reaction to allow the creature to reroll the ability check or saving throw if you have at least one hand free.

feat.name: Swimmer
entries: You have undergone extensive aquatic training to gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed.
You can hold your breath a number of minutes equal to 2 + twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 minute).
When you fall into water, you take no bludgeoning damage from the fall if you are not {@condition incapacitated}.
You can't be knocked {@condition prone} while you are underwater.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The kuo-toa idol sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Skeleton Crew
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Horde
entries: The crew can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the horde can move through any opening large enough for a Medium skeleton. Additionally, the crew is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The crew can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

trait.name: Horde Turn Resistance
entries: The crew has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead. Additionally, the crew can be affected by the Destroy Undead feature regardless of CR limits, but has advantage on the saving throw against it and is not destroyed on a failed save. Instead, it takes radiant damage equal to 10 × the cleric's level on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crew makes four attacks, or two attacks if the crew has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Volley
entries: The crew fires a simultaneous barrage of pistol shots. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 ({@damage 8d10}) piercing damage, or 22 ({@damage 4d10}) piercing damage if the crew has half its hit points or fewer. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the volgoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Crushing Movement
entries: The first time the volgoth moves into a space occupied by a creature or object on a turn, it can attempt to ram into it. A target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The creature or object is then pushed out of the volgoth's space.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The volgoth is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The volgoth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The volgoth's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Onboard Weaponry
entries: The volgoth has six ballistas on its deck. Each ballista can be attacked (AC 15; 50 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a ballista deals no damage to the volgoth.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The volgoth has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The volgoth is considered to be an Undead creature in addition to being a Construct.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The volgoth's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

action.name: Multiatack
entries: The volgoth can use its Frightful Presence, make three attacks, and use its Reel. The volgoth can't make more ballista attacks on a turn than the number of ballistas it has remaining from its Onboard Weaponry.

action.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rope
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 50 ft., one target. {@h}the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). The rope can be attacked (AC 11, 2 hit points; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage). Destroying a rope deals no damage to the volgoth, but frees the creature {@condition restrained} by it.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Reel
entries: The volgoth pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the volgoth's choice that is within 120 feet of the volgoth and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the volgoth's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: The volgoth makes a slam attack.

legendary.name: Casts a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The volgoth casts a spell from its Innate Spellcasting trait.

legendary.name: Ghostly Shriek (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The volgoth unleashes a ghostly shriek, wracking all creatures with immense pain. Each non-undead creature within 120 feet of the volgoth that can hear the shriek must a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw against this magic, taking 35 (10d6) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The whale can't use its blindsight while deafened.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the whale or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The whale can hold its breath for 90 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The whale has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The whale deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whale makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries:
{@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 6d6 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the whale. A swallowed creature is blinded and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage at the start of each of the whale's turns.

If the whale takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 20 feet of the whale. If the whale dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sonar Burst (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The whale releases a blast of thunderous energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) thunder damage and become stunned until the end of the whale's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't stunned. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried also take the damage.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The shoal has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shoal has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The shoal deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Swarm-Like
entries: The shoal can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny fish.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The shoal can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 10d6}) piercing damage, or 17 ({@damage 5d6}) piercing damage if the shoal has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Gaseous Form
entries:
If the creeper isn't in a moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour), it can use its action to transform into a Gargantuan cloud of fog, or back into its true form. While in cloud form, its space is heavily obscured, it is weightless, has a flying speed of 10 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the creeper can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage.

If the creeper is ever within a moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour), it instantly reverts to its true form.

trait.name: Invisible in Water (True Form Only)
entries: The creeper is invisible while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The creeper has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Water Form (True Form Only)
entries: The creeper can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Constrict (True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the creeper tries to drown it, and the creeper can't constrict another target.

reaction.name: Elemental Absorption
entries: When the creeper takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, it can gain resistance to the triggering damage type until the end of its next turn, and its next melee attack it hits with before the end of its next turn deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage of the triggering type. Additionally, each creature that starts its turn within the creeper's space before the end of the creeper's next turn takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage of the triggering type.

monster.name: Gold Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hypnotic Pattern (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The golem creates a twisting pattern of colors inside a 30-foot cube originating from it, which appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature inside the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {{@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While {{@condition charmed} by this effect, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0. The effect ends for a creature if it takes any damage, or if someone else uses an action to shake it out of its stupor.

monster.name: Ice Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Aversion of Fire
entries: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 50 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Cold Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Water Walking
entries: The golem can move across the surface of liquid water as if it were harmless solid ground, and rises at a rate of 60 feet per round if submerged.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the golem's next turn.

action.name: Sleep Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The golem exhales sleep gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

trait.name: Advanced Telepathy
entries: The crystazoa can perceive the content of any telepathic communication used within 120 feet of it, and it can't be surprised by creatures with any form of telepathy.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The crystazoa can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Evasive Movement
entries: The crystazoa doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies or swims out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The crystazoa senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn't itself magical

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crystazoa makes two tendril attacks and one bite attack, or it makes two crystal shard attacks and uses its Explosive Crystal.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated creature. {@h}33 ({@damage 8d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If a creature fails this saving throw and is already poisoned, it becomes stunned for the duration, and if it is already stunned, it becomes {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending all of the effects on a success.

action.name: Crystal Shard
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Explosive Crystal
entries:
The crystazoa chooses a creature it hit with its crystal shard attack this turn, causing the crystal embedded in it to vibrate with explosive energy until the start of the crystazoa's next turn, at which point it explodes. Each creature within 10 feet of the crystal when it explodes must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The creature that the shard is embedded in has disadvantage on the saving throw.

Until the crystal explodes, a creature, including the target, can use its bonus action to make a {@dc 17} Strength check to remove the crystal. Once removed, the crystal can be picked up and wielded as an improvised ranged weapon.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The seluchin can hold its breath for 30 days.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the seluchin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Lightning Aversion
entries: If the seluchin takes lightning damage, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the start of its next turn. The DC for this saving throw is equal to half the lightning damage the seluchin took.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The seluchin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The seluchin deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Swimming Leap
entries: With a 60-foot swimming start, the seluchin can jump up to 60 feet out of a body of water. When it surfaces as part of such a jump, it creates rolling waves that propagate out around it. Each creature in the water within 120 feet of the seluchin must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Whirlpool Dive
entries: If the seluchin dives at least 120 feet straight down into a body of water, it forms a whirlpool in a 120-foot radius centered on the surface of the water around it, which lasts until the start of the seluchin's next turn. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is pulled up to 60 feet toward the center of the whirlpool and becomes {@condition restrained} by the whirlpool. On a successful save, a creature is pulled 30 feet toward the center of the whirlpool and isn't {@condition restrained}. If a creature reaches the center of the whirlpool, it is also pulled 60 feet underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The seluchin can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 5d8 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the seluchin can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the seluchin's choice that is within 120 feet of the seluchin and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {{@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the seluchin's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The seluchin makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the seluchin, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the seluchin's turns. If the seluchin takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the seluchin must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the seluchin. If the seluchin dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Primal Roar (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The seluchin emits a world-rending roar. Each creature within 120 feet of the seluchin that can hear the roar must make a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) thunder damage and becomes {@condition stunned}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. A {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the seluchin is at the surface of a body of water, its roar creates a wave that functions as per the tsunami spell (save {@dc 24}) appearing in a space adjacent to the seluchin. The wave produced by the roar is not magical, and the seluchin doesn't need to maintain concentration on it.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The seluchin makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The seluchin moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The seluchin makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The lochkinhaz can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Electrifying
entries: The lochkinhaz can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, if the lochkinhaz is submerged and conscious, the water in a 10-foot radius around the lochkinhaz is electrified. Any creature that enters the water's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lochkinhaz makes four attacks: one with its bite and three with its claws. When its water spray is available, it can use the spray in place of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}) or thrown up to 10 feet in a direction of the lochkinhaz's choice. The lochkinhaz has four claws, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Swallow
entries:
The lochkinhaz makes one bite attack with advantage against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the {@condition grapple} ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition {@condition restrained}}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the lochkinhaz, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the lochkinhaz's turns. A lochkinhaz can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the lochkinhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the lochkinhaz must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the lochkinhaz. If the lochkinhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Water Spray (Recharge 4–6)
entries: The lochkinhaz opens its gaping maw and forcefully ejects electrified water in a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide.  Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the worm dies, it explodes in a blast of electrified gore. Each creature within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the worm is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The worm can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes two bite attacks, or uses its Flare and makes a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns. If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Flare
entries: The worm releases a brilliant flash of light. Each creature within 60 feet of the worm that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be blinded and stunned for 1 minute. Creature with darkvision have disadvantage on this saving throw. A creature can repeat the saving throw each time it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once a creature successfully saves against this effect, or if this effect ends for it, that creature is immune to the Flare of all mottled worms for the next 24 hours.

from: in humanoid form, 12 in shark and hybrid form

swim.condition: (0 ft., swim 40 ft. in shark form; 30 ft., swim 30 ft. in hybrid form)

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The wereshark can use its action to polymorph into a shark-humanoid hybrid or into a Large shark, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The wereshark can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The wereshark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing (Shark Form Only)
entries: The wereshark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The wereshark makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite and only one of which can be with its net.

action.name: Bite (Shark or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereshark lycanthropy.

action.name: Trident (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage in melee, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Net (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 5/15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 10} Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

swim.condition: (0 ft., swim 60 ft. in squid form; 30 ft., swim 40 ft. in hybrid form)

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The weresquid can use its action to polymorph into a squid-humanoid hybrid or into a Medium squid, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The weresquid can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Water Breathing (Squid Form Only)
entries: The weresquid can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The weresquid makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Bite (Squid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with weresquid lycanthropy.

action.name: Tentacle (Squid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}}). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage at the start of each of the weresquid's turns. The weresquid can have up to two targets {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Shortsword (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ink Cloud (Squid or Hybrid Form Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A 20-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the weresquid if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the weresquid can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

monster.name: Werewhale

walk.condition: (0 ft. swim 40 ft. in whale form; 30 ft. swim 30 ft. in hybrid form)

senses: blindsight 60 ft. (whale or hybrid form only)

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werewhale can use its action to polymorph into a Large whale-humanoid hybrid or into a Huge whale, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Echolocation (Whale or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werewhale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath (Whale or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werewhale can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The werewhale has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werewhale makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Bite (Whale or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewhale lycanthropy.

action.name: Glaive (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Razored Bodies
entries: A creature that touches the swarm or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage. The first time the swarm enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny reef wormling. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the razor reef remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a length of coral reef.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The razor reef can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Razored Body
entries: A creature that touches the razor reef or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) slashing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the razor reef can't constrict another target. A {@condition grappled} creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage at the start of each of the razor reef's turns.

reaction.name: Reef Trap
entries: When a creature within 10 feet of the razor reef touches it or hits it with a melee attack, the razor reef can make a constrict attack against the creature.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rusalka's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The rusalka can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The rusalka can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aqua Step (Recharge 6)
entries: As a bonus action, the rusalka can teleport to an unoccupied location within 30 feet of her, provided that both the space she's teleporting from and her destination are in or at least touching water. The destination need not be within line of sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The rusalka has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rusalka makes two attacks with her hair.

action.name: Hair
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 10}) and pulled to within 5 feet of the rusalka. The rusalka can have up to three creatures {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

action.name: Constrict
entries: Each creature grappled by the rusalka's hair must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and becomes {@condition restrained} until the start of the rusalka's next turn or until the grapple ends. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

monster.name: Young Storm Manta
languages: understands Aquan and Auran but can't speak

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The manta takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The manta calls down a bolt of lightning on a point it can see within 120 feet below it. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rusalka's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The rusalka can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Aquatic Stealth
entries: While submerged in water, the rusalka can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The rusalka has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rusalka Magic  (Recharge 4–6)
entries: As a bonus action, the rusalka uses one of the following abilities, provided she is in or at least touching water: Aqua Step. The rusalka teleports to an unoccupied location within 60 feet of her that is also in or at least touching water. The destination need not be within line of sight. Watery Shield. The rusalka surrounds herself with a watery shield, increasing her AC by 2 until the start of her next turn. At the start of her next turn, each creature within 5 feet of the rusalka must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away from her and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rusalka makes three attacks: one with her claws and two with her hair.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hair
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) and pulled closer until it is within 15 feet of the rusalka. If the target is already {@condition grappled} by the rusalka, she can instead move it up to 10 feet to another point within 15 feet of her. The rusalka can have up to five creatures {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

action.name: Constrict
entries: Each creature grappled by the rusalka's hair must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and becomes {@condition restrained} until the start of the rusalka's next turn or until the grapple ends. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The rusalka makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Hair Attack
entries: The rusalka makes a hair attack.

legendary.name: Draining Hair (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One creature grappled by the rusalka must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The rusalka regains a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

monster.name: Adult Storm Manta
languages: understands Aquan and Auran but can't speak

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the manta fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The manta has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Storm Bringer
entries: While out of water, the manta is surrounded by strong winds, which blow around it in a 30-foot radius. The wind extinguishes unprotected flames in the area that are torch-sized or smaller, and disperses any vapor, gas, or fog that can be dispersed by strong winds. The area is difficult terrain for creatures other than the manta, and ranged weapon attacks that pass in or out of the wind are made at disadvantage.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The manta takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The manta makes a tail attack and uses its Lighting Strike twice.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike
entries: The manta calls down a bolt of lightning on a point it can see within 120 feet below it. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Lightning Burst (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The manta releases a burst of lightning around it. Each creature within 30 feet of the manta must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 44 ({@damage 8d10}) lightning damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition paralyzed}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The manta moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The manta makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Lightning Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The manta uses its Lighting Strike.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ceirean's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks). Ceirean can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Ceirean can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny silver fish (swimming speed 30 ft.) or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed change noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Ceirean can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Ceirean knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Glass Aversion (Fish Form Only)
entries: If Ceirean is sealed within a container made of glass, it is {@condition incapacitated} until it is removed from the container.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Ceirean fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Ceirean can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Ceirean deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Swallow (True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Huge or smaller target. {@h}The target is swallowed by Ceirean. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained} and has total cover against attacks and other effects outside of Ceirean. Ceirean can deal 35 ({@damage 10d6}) radiant damage to each swallowed creature of its choice at the start of its turn.

nbsp;  If Ceirean takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, Ceirean must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of Ceirean. If Ceirean dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Spit (True Form Only)
entries: One target swallowed by Ceirean is regurgitated up to 120 feet in a direction of Ceirean's choice and knocked {@condition prone}. If a regurgitated target strikes an object, the target and object each take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet the target was regurgitated. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Slam (True Form Only)
entries: Ceirean slams its body down in a 30-foot-cube originating from it. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 63 ({@damage 10d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes no damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space outside the area.

action.name: Divine Blessing (3/Day)
entries: Ceirean places a divine boon on one creature it can see within 60 feet of it, choosing one ability. The target has advantage on all ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls that use that ability for 24 hours, until Ceirean revokes the boon (no action required), or until Ceirean dies. The target also gains an additional benefit based on the while blessed, based on the chosen ability:
Strength. The target is considered to be a Gargantuan creature for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity and it can't be pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
Dexterity. The target's speed is doubled and it can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.
Constitution. The target it is immune to poison and disease and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.
Intelligence. The target automatically detects visual illusions and succeeds on saving throws against them.
Wisdom. The target can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} and magically knows if it hears a lie.
Charisma. The target can cast {@spell command} (save {@dc 24}) without expending a spell slot.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Ceirean moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Ceirean makes a swallow attack or uses its Slam or Spit.

legendary.name: Healing Pulse (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Ceirean releases a wave of soothing energy. Each creature of Ceirean's choice within 60 feet of it regains 35 ({@dice 10d6}) hit points and is cured of any poisons or diseases afflicting it.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Karkos can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Bottom Treader
entries: Karkos can't swim, and sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater, and is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
entries:
As a bonus action after moving at least 10 feet on the ground, Karkos can send a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, which Karkos ignores. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or the creature's concentration is broken.
    If used while underwater, the shock wave also propagates through the water in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on Karkos. Each creature within the area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away from Karkos and knocked {@condition prone}.
    The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is {@condition restrained}, requiring a successful {@dc 20} Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, 
the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} or become trapped.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Karkos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Karkos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Karkos's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Karkos deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Karkos makes two grasping claw attacks and uses its Claw Slam twice, targeting two different areas that are at least 60 feet apart. It can use its Fling in place of any of its grasping claw attacks.

action.name: Grasping Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Karkos can automatically hit the target with its grasping claw.

action.name: Claw Slam
entries: Karkos slams one of its massive claws down, targeting a 30-foot-cube within 120 feet of it. The area must be at least 30 feet away from Karkos. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 51 ({@damage 8d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes no damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space outside the area.

action.name: Fling
entries: Karkos throws a Huge or smaller creature it is grappling, or a Huge or smaller object it is holding. The target is hurled up to 120 feet horizontally in a direction of Karkos' choice. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or land {@condition prone} and take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tsunami (Recharge 5–6)
entries: Karkos disturbs the surface of a body of water, creating a massive wave that functions as per the tsunami spell (save {@dc 24}) appearing in a space adjacent to Karkos. The wave produced by this effect is not magical, and Karkos doesn't need to maintain concentration on it.

reaction.name: Catching
entries: If a Huge or smaller object is hurled at Karkos, it can catch the missile and take no damage from it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Karkos makes a grasping claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Karkos moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Claw Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Karkos uses its Claw Slam.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Karkos can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Bottom Treader
entries: Karkos can't swim, and sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater, and is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
entries:
As a bonus action after moving at least 10 feet on the ground, Karkos can send a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, which Karkos ignores. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or the creature's concentration is broken.
    If used while underwater, the shock wave also propagates through the water in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on Karkos. Each creature within the area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away from Karkos and knocked {@condition prone}.
    The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is {@condition restrained}, requiring a successful {@dc 20} Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, 
the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} or become trapped.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Karkos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Karkos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Karkos's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Karkos deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

trait.name: Grim Fortitude
entries: Karkos is immune to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Stench of Death
entries: Karkos reeks of corruption and foul magic. Each creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Karkos must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) necrotic damage and be poisoned until the start of its next turn. Additionally, creatures within 30 feet of Karkos regain half as many hit points from any healing. If Karkos is fully submerged in holy water, it permanently loses this trait, along with its Grim Fortitude trait and Maddening Miasma legendary action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Karkos makes two grasping claw attacks and uses its Claw Slam twice, targeting two different areas that are at least 60 feet apart. It can use its Fling in place of any of its grasping claw attacks.

action.name: Grasping Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Karkos can automatically hit the target with its grasping claw.

action.name: Claw Slam
entries: Karkos slams one of its massive claws down, targeting a 30-foot-cube within 120 feet of it. The area must be at least 30 feet away from Karkos. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 51 ({@damage 8d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes no damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space outside the area.

action.name: Fling
entries: Karkos throws a Huge or smaller creature it is grappling, or a Huge or smaller object it is holding. The target is hurled up to 120 feet horizontally in a direction of Karkos' choice. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or land {@condition prone} and take 3 {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tsunami (Recharge 5–6)
entries: Karkos disturbs the surface of a body of water, creating a massive wave that functions as per the tsunami spell (save {@dc 24}) appearing in a space adjacent to Karkos. The wave produced by this effect is not magical, and Karkos doesn't need to maintain concentration on it.

reaction.name: Catching
entries: If a Huge or smaller object is hurled at Karkos, it can catch the missile and take no damage from it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Karkos makes a grasping claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Karkos moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Claw Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Karkos uses its Claw Slam.

legendary.name: Maddening Miasma (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Karkos releases a wave of twisted miasma. Each creature within 120 feet of Karkos must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or become {{@condition charmed} by Karkos. The {{@condition charmed} target regards Karkos as its sole master, and protects it at any cost. While charmed, a creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1, and it is unable to cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. At the end of each of its turns, a {{@condition charmed} creature can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the effect ends on the target. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Karkos' Maddening Corruption for the next 24 hours.

On a failed save, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is {@condition restrained}, requiring a successful {@dc 20} Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Karkos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Karkos's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Karkos deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

trait.name: Psionic Barrier
entries: Karkos and each creature within 120 feet of it has full cover from effects that originate more than 120 feet away from it, and has resistance to all damage.

trait.name: Protection Stones
entries: Karkos is surrounded by six Large psionic lodestones, which float at a distance of 30 feet away from Karkos. Each stone is an object with AC 20, 100 hit points, immunity to psychic and poison damage, and resistance to all other damage. For each stone around it, Karkos gains a +1 bonus to its AC and saving throws, and gains 50 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns. If all six stones are destroyed, Karkos loses its Psionic Barrier trait and Psychic Pulse legendary action.

legendary.name: Psychic Pulse (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Karkos releases a burst of psionic energy in a low drone around it. Each creature within 120 feet of Karkos must succeed on a {@dc 24} Intelligence saving throw or become incapacitated for 1 hour. At the end of each of its turns, an incapacitated creature can make another Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the effect ends on the target. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Karkos' Psychic Pulse for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the reef remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary coral reef.

trait.name: Limited Spell Barrier
entries: An invisible aura forms a 10-foot-radius barrier around the reef for as long as it lives. Spells of 3rd level or lower can't affect creatures or objects within the barrier, and the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The reef can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Flow Sense
entries: The man o' war can't use its blindsight while it is out of water, and can only sense creatures and objects within the same body of water as it.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The dread man o' war can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Variant: Dread Necromancy
entries: A humanoid that dies while poisoned by the man o' war rises as a zombie 1d4 hours later.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 10}), and must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is {@condition paralyzed} and is unable to hold its breath. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effects on a success. Until this grapple ends, the man o' war can't use its tendrils on another target.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The anglerfish has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Sand Camouflage
entries: The anglerfish has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The anglerfish can breathe only underwater.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the anglerfish can't bite another target.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The manatee can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Archerfish Hunting
entries: If the archerfish knocks a creature prone with its water shot attack, the archerfish can take a bonus action on its turn to make a bite attack against the target.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The archerfish has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The archerfish can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Water Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature that is not submerged in water. {@h}If the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from the archerfish and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The anglerfish has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Sand Camouflage

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

monster.name: Giant Seagull
languages: understands Common and Aquan but can't speak them

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The seagull makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

entries: The sea turtle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The shark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the shark. A swallowed creature is blinded and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the shark, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage at the start of each of the shark's turns. If the shark takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the shark must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the shark. If the shark dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The squid can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The squid makes two attacks, only one of which can be with its beak.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). A {@condition grappled} creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage at the start of each of the squid's turns.

action.name: Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A 20-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the squid if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the squid can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The squid can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The shrimp sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The shrimp has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The shrimp can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shrimp makes one claw attack and uses its Cavitating Smash.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, the shrimp can pull the target up to 10 feet toward itself, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until the grapple ends, the shrimp can't use its claw on another target.

action.name: Cavitating Smash
entries: The shrimp slams the water with extreme speed, targeting one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage and is stunned until end of the terror shrimp's next turn. On a success, it takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The commodore has advantage on saving throws against being {{@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Captain's Command (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The commodore can use a bonus action on its turn to call out to up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature can use its reaction to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Dodge, or Use an Object action.

trait.name: Tactical Teamwork (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the commodore succeeds on a saving throw against an effect that targets at least one other creature within 30 feet of it, it can cause up to three creatures targeted by the same effect to automatically succeed on the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The commodore can make two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the commodore can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the commodore. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the commodore is incapacitated.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The coral caller is a 4th-level spellcaster. The coral caller's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The coral caller has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit ({@hit 5} to hit with {@spell shillelagh}), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage with {@spell shillelagh}.

action.name: Coral Calling (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The caller creates a reef that extends around it in a 10-foot radius and moves with it. When the caller creates this reef, it can designate any number of creatures it can see to be unaffected by it. Additionally, each designated creature has half cover from effects that originate from outside the reef while within it. The reef is difficult terrain for affected creatures, and each affected creature takes 2d4 piercing damage if it starts its turn in the area or enters the area for the first time on a turn.

reaction.name: Breath of the Sea (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the caller casts a spell, the caller can make an ability check using its Wisdom against a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell fails and the caller grants 7 (2d6) temporary hit points to up to three creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. The caller must be able to see the caster in order to use this reaction.

trait.name: Special Ability
entries: In addition to its magic armor and weapon, the defiler carries an {@item alchemy jug} and a {@item ring of water walking}. These items cease to be magical if they are taken more than 30 feet away from the defiler or if the defiler dies.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Defiler is a 5th-level spellcaster. The defiler's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The defiler has the following spells prepared, which are artificer spells for it:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The defiler makes two light crossbow attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: +1 Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Draining Tar (1/Day)
entries:
The defiler causes a 10-foot-cube area it can see within 60 feet of it to fill with sickly tar. The area becomes difficult terrain for each creature other than the defiler. Each creature other than the defiler takes 1d6 necrotic damage if it starts its turn in the area or enters the area for the first time on a turn.
When the defiler casts a spell of 1st level or higher, it can cause the tar to spread to a number of adjacent 10-foot-cubes equal to the spell's level. Each new cube must have at least one one face adjacent to another cube of this tar.

trait.name: Aqueous Transportation (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the hydromancer can teleport to an unoccupied location it can see within 30 feet of it, provided that both the space it is teleporting from and its destination are in or at least touching water.

trait.name: Create Pool
entries:
When the hydromancer casts a spell of 1st level or higher, it creates a 10-foot-radius pool of water centered on 
a point it can see within 30 feet of it, which lasts for 1 minute, and stays in its location, even on inclines or if subjected to strong winds. If the hydromancer starts its turn within a pool, its speed increases by 10 feet until the end of its turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hydromancer is a 5th-level spellcaster. The hydromancer's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The hydromancer has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The gilded heir is a 5th-level spellcaster. The gilded heir's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The gilded heir has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Quicken Spell (2/Day)
entries: The heir casts a spell it knows that has a casting time of 1 action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The heir can make one golden longsword attack and one launch treasure attack.

action.name: Golden Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Launch Treasure
