entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage. This attack conjures a gilded object, which disappears after the attack is made.

reaction.name: All that Glitters (3/Day)
entries: When a creature targets the heir with an attack or harmful spell, the heir can force it to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition charmed} by the heir until the end of the heir's next turn, and must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. While the creature is {@condition charmed} in this way, it can't willingly move away from the heir.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The holy water minister is a 5th-level spellcaster. The holy water minister's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The holy water minister has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Divine Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pulled up to 10 feet toward the minister. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes an extra 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

action.name: Holy Water Ministration (3/Day)
entries: The minister anoints a willing creature within 5 feet of it with water. The target regains 3 (1d6) hit points and is cured of one disease or poison affecting it.

action.name: Water Ward (1/Day)
entries: The minister douses up to six creatures within 20 feet of it with blessed water. Each target gains 10 temporary hit points, which last for 1 hour. While a creature has these hit points, it can walk on the surface of water as if it were harmless solid ground, has resistance to acid and fire damage, and gains a +1 bonus to AC.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the marauder can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide Action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The marauder deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the marauder that isn't incapacitated and the marauder doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Terrifying Strike
entries: When the marauder scores a critical hit or reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it can force a creature it can see within 30 feet of it to make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {{@condition frightened} until the start of the marauder's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marauder makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
footerEntries: *The warlock casts this spell before combat.

trait.name: Bosun's Lash
entries: As a bonus action, the warlock can conjure a spectral officer to whip a willing creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The creature takes 2 (1d4) force damage, and gains a bonus equal to the damage taken to the next attack roll or ability check it makes before the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Eternal Sailor
entries: The warlock doesn't need to breathe, and being underwater doesn't impose disadvantage on its attacks or cost it any extra movement.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Haunted Hull (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The warlock conjures a piece of a ghostly ship, choosing from one of the following options, each of which last for 1 minute:
Crow's Nest. While the warlock isn't deafened, it knows the location of every creature within 120 feet of it.

Possessed Rigging. One creature within 60 feet of the warlock must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check, freeing itself on a success.

Stolen Sails. Each creature of the warlock's choice within 30 feet of the warlock must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or have its speed reduced by 10 feet for the duration. The warlock's speed increases by 10 feet for the duration.

trait.name: Mantle of Coral
entries: The guardian's AC can't be lower than 16. When a creature within 5 feet of the guardian hits it with a melee attack, the creature takes 2 (1d4) piercing damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guardian makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage in melee, or 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage at range.

reaction.name: Bristling Defense
entries: The guardian halves the damage it takes from an attack that hit it and deals 5 (2d4) piercing damage to the attacker. The guardian must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Gale Step
entries: When the stormcaller moves for the first time on its turn, it can double its speed until the end of the turn. If it moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a weapon attack before the end of the turn, the attack deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage. Once it uses this ability, the stormcaller can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Stormy Stealth
entries: While in heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other water-based phenomena, the stormcaller can take the Hide action as a bonus action, and can attempt to hide even if it is only lightly obscured.

trait.name: Cyclone Burst (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the stormcaller uses its Gale Step, it can release a burst of wind around it. Each creature within 10 feet of the stormcaller must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or take 9 (2d8) thunder damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away from the stormcaller and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stormcaller makes two attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Rain Shield
entries: The stormcaller adds 2 to its AC against one ranged attack that would hit it. To do so, the stormcaller must see the attacker and must be in light or heavy precipitation.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sunken herald is a 5th-level spellcaster. The sunken herald's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The sunken herald knows the following spells, which are sorcerer spells for it:

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sunken herald deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Quicken Spell (2/Day)
entries: The sunken herald casts a spells it knows that has a casting time of 1 action as a bonus action.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Freakish Graft
entries: The herald warps the flesh of its hand around one object that it's holding. The herald can't be disarmed of the object or drop it.

trait.name: Flooded Lunges
entries: The sailor doesn't need to breathe, and is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the sailor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal corpse.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the sailor can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the sailor takes 20 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sailor makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spectral Chains
entries: The sailor sends a spectral chain out toward a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or have its speed halved until the start of the sailor's next turn and be pulled up to 15 feet toward the sailor.

reaction.name: Retaliating Chains
entries: When a creature hits the sailor with an attack while within 5 feet of it, the sailor can cause spectral chains to wrap around the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of the sailor's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wave dancer's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Dancing Waves
entries: The dancer can walk on the surface of liquid water as if it were harmless solid ground. While the dancer is standing on the surface of water, it has a +2 bonus to its AC and has advantage on any Strength or Dexterity saving throws it makes.

trait.name: Rippling Strike
entries: If the dancer is within 5 feet of a body of water, it can make its unarmed strike attacks as if it were at another point it can see within 30 feet of it within the same body of water, using its own sense.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the dancer is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dancer makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.  If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the dancer.

action.name: Fluid State (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The dancer casts aqueous form targeting itself. It can speak, attack, and cast spells as normal while transformed by the spell.

action.name: Water Whip (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The dancer lashes out a whip of water toward a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage is pushed up to 20 feet away from the dancer and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the dancer deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 3}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the dancer catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The whistler is a 4th-level spellcaster. The whistler's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells:

trait.name: Song of Rest
entries: The whistler can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra 1d6 hit points if it spends any Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. The whistler can confer this benefit on itself as well.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Turning Tune (3/Day)
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 15 feet of the whistler misses with an attack, the whistler can allow that creature to reroll the attack against another target.

reaction.name: Mocking Melody
entries: When a creature misses the whistler or a friendly creature within 20 feet with an attack, the whistler can cast vicious mockery targeting that creature.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rider is a 5th-level spellcaster. The rider's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The rider has the following cleric spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The rider casts this spell before combat.

trait.name: Long Road Ahead
entries: When the rider finishes a short or long rest, it can grant 5 temporary hit points to up to 6 creatures it can see. While a creature has these hit points, its movement speed increases by 10 feet, and it has advantage on Constitution saving throws made against exhaustion from a forced march.

trait.name: Imbue Mobility
entries: When a creature regains hit points from a spell cast by the rider, the creature can use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Zealous Charge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The rider chooses a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. Until the start of the rider's next turn, the creature's speed is doubled, and each creature that it moves within 5 feet of for the first time on a turn during this duration must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. A creature takes 16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Zealous Sailor
entries: Some zealous riders may serve as scouts and guides on expeditions at sea. These priests often lead in prayers to maintain crew moral, and utilize their powers to repair and bolster their vessels. Such sailors may forego having a divine steed.
A vehicle crewed by a zealous sailor may be under the effects of a {@spell enhance vehicle|ABYSS} spell.

trait.name: Crushing Movement
entries: The first time the kalantropis moves into a space occupied by a creature or object on a turn, it can attempt to ram into it. A target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The creature or object is then pushed out of the kalantropis' space.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the kalantropis remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a pile of bones.

trait.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries: The kalantropis can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 30 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the kalantropis, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 18} Strength check against it.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the kalantropis fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries: Whenever the kalantropis is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Necrotic Vents
entries: When the kalantropis regains hit points from its Necrotic Absorption, glowing purple vents form along its body, causing it to shed dim light in a 5-foot-radius until the start of its next turn. At the start of its next turn, the kalantropis expels necrotic energy from these vents. Each non-undead creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the kalantropis is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 year unless it is prevented from doing so by a wish spell.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The kalantropis deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The kalantropis has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kalantropis makes three attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 50 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the kalantropis can't use the same tendril on another target.

action.name: Reel
entries: The kalantropis pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

action.name: Murky Discharge (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The kalantropis spits forth black sludge in a 60-foot cone. Each non-undead creature in the area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The sludge remains in the area until the start of the kalantropis's next turn if it is underwater, lightly obscuring the area. Each undead creature within the sludge has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws it makes, and its weapon attacks deal an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Tendril Attack
entries: The kalantropis makes a tendril attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The kalantropis moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Fester (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature {@condition grappled} by the kalantropis must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and its maximum hit points are not reduced.

legendaryGroup.name: Ceirean
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Ceirean takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Ceirean can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: All water within 600 feet of Ceirean becomes infused with divine energy, becoming holy water for the next minute. A fiend or undead creature that starts its turn within this holy water takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.
Ceirean magically teleports to an unoccupied space that is submerged in water within 600 feet of it.
One creature or vehicle within 600 feet of Ceirean that is in water has its movement speed halved until the end of its next turn, as a whirlpool wraps around it.

regionalEffects: Ceirean's divine presence creating the following effects in the area around it:

items: Rainfall within 3 miles of Ceirean is infused with divine energy, becoming holy water. A fiend or undead creature that starts its turn within this holy rain takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.
The surface of water within 3 miles of Ceirean displays strange ripples which form runes and patterns.
Coral within 3 miles of Ceirean is silver and sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

regionalEffects: If Ceirean dies, the rain immediately ceases to be holy water and the ripples on the surface of water immediately disappear. The coral continues to glow for 1d4 days, after which it withers.

legendaryGroup.name: Karkos
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Karkos takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Karkos can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Thick fog rises from the surface of the water in a 120-foot-radius cylinder, 30 feet high, centered on Karkos. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

Karkos creates three rippling walls of stone, which rise out from the ground in three 120-foot-long lines, each 5 feet thick and 20 feet tall. When a wall appears, each creature within its area is pushed to one side of Karkos' choice, and must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage. Each 10-foot length of wall is an object made of stone with AC 15 and 30 hit points. These walls last indefinitely, but are susceptible to damage from Karkos' Earth-Shaking Movement.

Karkos telepathically reads the minds of creature around it. Each creature within 120 feet of Karkos must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, Karkos knows its location and has advantage on attack rolls made against it until initiative count 20 on the next round.

regionalEffects: As a being of incredible size and power, carrying the remnants of an abandoned city on its back, Karkos' presence inevitably affects its surroundings, creating the following effects:

items: Small tremorous earthquakes can be felt as far as 10 miles away from Karkos. These tremors don't cause any structural damage, but may knock over loose objects and cause noticeable rippling on the surface of water within the area.

Crabs and other crustaceans within 3 miles of Karkos come under the 'enlarge' effects of the enlarge/reduce spell and become unusually aggressive, banding together in packs and moving toward Karkos to aid it.
Objects crafted by ancient karkinos from stone and coral can be found littering the seafloor within 1 miles of Karkos

regionalEffects: If Karkos dies, the earthquakes stop immediately, and any enlarged crustaceans revert to their normal size and behavior over the course of 1d10 days. The karkinoan objects remain at the seabed until buried by sediment or found.

legendaryGroup.name: Volgoth
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the volgoth takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the volgoth can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The volgoth conjures visions of the crew's loved ones on the surface. Each humanoid creature of its choice within the lair must Make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {{@condition charmed}  by the fog until initiative count 20 on the next round. While the creature is {{@condition charmed} in this way, it can't take any actions that directly harm the volgoth, and the volgoth has advantage on attacks made against it.

Noxious fog fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a corpse the volgoth chooses within 120 feet of it. The cloud spreads around corners and heavily obscures the area. It remains until the volgoth dismisses it as an  action, uses this lair action again, or dies. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) also disperses it. Any non-undead creature in the cloud when it appears must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

The volgoth chooses up to six creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

regionalEffects: The region around the volgoth is warped by its corrupting presence, creating the following effects:

items: Increasingly strange occurrences are observed within 1 mile of the volgoth. Pieces of wood boarding begin to rot. Vermin aboard ships become bolder. Coin and rations go missing. Food spoils at an increased rate. Fish brought out of water release a foul black ichor when cut. Dead seagulls fall from the sky.
Navigational equipment within 3 miles of the volgoth produce inaccurate results, directing ships erratically. Checks made to avoid getting lost are made at disadvantage.

For each hour a humanoid spends 1 hour within 1 mile of the volgoth, it must succeed on a  {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or gain a flaw from the Madness of the Volgoth table, which lasts until cured by a {@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell greater restoration}, or {@spell wish} spell. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw can't be affected by this regional effect again for 24 hours.

regionalEffects: If the volgoth dies, all these effects end immediately.

regionalEffects.caption: Madness of the Volgoth
rows: Everyone is out to get me. There is no one I can trust.
I am drawn towards the deepest seas. Land holds no value for me anymore.
I am the most capable individual to lead this vessel. No one else is worthy.
I have terrifying recurring nightmares. Sometimes I wake up with scratches on my body. If questioned, I can never recall how I got them.
I spend every moment of my free time staring into the distance in search of a sign.
I'm almost there, only a few hours now. We can't stop travelling. I won't explain where we are going.

legendaryGroup.name: Kalantropis
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the kalantropis takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; The kalantropis can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The kalantropis chooses up to four creatures within 500 feet of it, releasing an agonizing mental scream. If the target is not native to the plane it is currently on, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 8d6 psychic damage and is {{@condition frightened} of the kalantropis until initiative count 20 on the next turn. While {{@condition frightened} in this way, a target is overwhelmed by the desire to return to its native plane.
Each undead creature that the kalantropis can see can use its reaction to move up to its speed and make one weapon attack.

The kalantropis designates up to three 20-foot-radius spheres within 90 feet of it, which fill with miasma until initiative count 20 of the next round. Each creature that starts its turn within the miasma must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned until the smoke fades. While poisoned in this way, a creature suffers the effects of the {@spell slow} spell.

regionalEffects: Its decaying nature and desire to drive away intruders leave the ocean around the kalantropis an unbearable mire of sickness, creating the following effects:

items: Creatures within 1 mile of the kalantropis are haunted by hellish screams and moans, and feel the dread of being constantly watched.
A murky violet fog extends in a 3 mile radius around the kalantropis. Food within the area spoils at an increased rate, and fish within the area become diseased and emaciated.
Necrotic damage dealt to non-undead creatures within 1 mile of the kalantropis ignore resistances.

regionalEffects: If the kalantropis dies, the screams immediately cease, and the pestilence and negative energy stop affecting their space after {@dice 1d4} hours.

legendaryGroup.name: Storm Manta
regionalEffects: The raw elemental power that an adult storm manta exudes causes changes to the atmosphere around its lair, creating the following effects:

items: Heavy rain and strong winds rage within 1 mile of the manta's lair, accompanied by frequent lightning strikes.

Waves crash against the shore with increased intensity within 1 miles of the manta's lair. When a creature comes near the water's edge in the area, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be smashed against the rocks, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and dragged 20 feet out to sea.
Clouds within 3 miles of the manta's lair form into a slow- moving cyclone, darkening the sky.

regionalEffects: If the storm manta dies, these effects end immediately.

legendaryGroup.name: Seluchin
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the seluchin takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the seluchin can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Wisps of primal magic flow from the seluchin, casting dim light in a 100-foot radius around it until initiative count 20 on the next round. When a creature casts a spell while within this dim light, it must make on a {@dc 17} ability check using its spellcasting ability. On a failure, the magic recoils against it, and it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage per level of the spell it cast.

The seluchin chooses one creature it can see within 120 feet of it, marking the creature with wisps of primal energy until initiative count 20 on the next round. When an effect would deal lightning damage to the seluchin, it instead takes no damage and redirects the lightning toward the marked creature, which takes the damage instead.
Gusting winds howl over the water. Each creature within 300 feet of the seluchin that is not in the water must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

regionalEffects: Where the seluchin goes, dark storm clouds and crashing waves follow, creating the following effects:

items: Torrential rainfall and stormy winds rage within 6 miles of the seluchin. These storms are never accompanied by thunder or lightning.
Deep-sea beasts within 3 miles of the seluchin begin to flee the depths, causing them to surface unnaturally.

The surface of the water within 1 mile of the seluchin shimmers with strange arcane lights. When a creature teleports within the area, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} force damage.

regionalEffects: If the seluchin dies, deep-sea creatures return to their natural behavior, the rain and winds abate within {@dice 1d10} hours, and the arcane lights fade after {@dice 1d10} days.

item.name: Bag of Teeth
entries: This small sack is made of fish skin and contains a handful of quipper teeth. As an action, you can open the bag and scatter its contents in a body of water, creating a {@creature swarm of quippers|MM} which lasts for 10 minutes.

The swarm is hostile toward every creature. Roll initiative for the swarm, which has its own turns. On its turn, the swarm moves towards the nearest creature it can see and attacks it. If the swarm can't attack a creature on its turn, it instead takes the Dash action toward the nearest creature it can see. If the swarm can't see any creatures, it does nothing on its turn.

item.name: Bailing Twine
entries: This 50-foot length of hempen rope weighs 10 pounds. If one end of the rope is dipped into water, the rope absorbs and ejects the water out the other end at a rate of 1 gallon per round, or 10 gallons per minute.

item.name: Bantering Blade
entries: This well-worn cutlass is a veteran of hundreds of voyages across the seas. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can have the sword unleash a string of magical insults at the target, often with nautical allusions or crude humor. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The sword is a sentient chaotic neutral item with an Intelligence of 10, a Wisdom of 9, and a Charisma of 14. It has hearing and {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 10 feet.
The sword can speak, read, and understand Common. It communicates verbally, and its voice is slurred and theatrical.

entries.name: Personality
entries: The sword possess a vicious wit, enthusiastically mocking any that it strikes. It punctuates its attacks with verbal jabs and curses, questioning its opponent's honor, skill, or physical appearance. The sword prefers high adventures with good friends, and often voices support for decisions that lead to great exploits and dramatic duels.

item.name: Billowing Sailcloth
entries: This white canvas sailcloth is imbued with energy from the Elemental Plane of Air, and can be worn as a billowing cape. When held in both hands, the sailcloth slows your rate of descent to 10 feet per round (falling at the end of each of your turns). It can carry up to 400 pounds, but your rate of descent becomes 30 feet while it is carrying more than 200 pounds. If you let go of the sailcloth with either hand, you immediately fall as normal.

The sailcloth has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the sailcloth, you can use an action to speak the sailcloth's command word, expending 1 to 3 of its charges to create a powerful updraft which propels you upwards a 30 feet for each charge you spend. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

The sailcloth can also be used as a sail for any Large or smaller water vehicle (such as a rowboat). While used in this way, you can use an action to speak the sailcloth's command word, expending 1 to 3 of its charges to cause the sail to billow with wind. For the next 10 minutes, the vehicle's speed  increases by 10 feet per charge expended.

item.name: Blade of Parting Water
entries: This monolithic bronze blade has the pinkish hue of untarnished copper. Attacks made with this magic weapon don't suffer disadvantage from being underwater.
Whenever this weapon hits a creature with an amorphous form composed of liquid, such as an ooze or {@creature water elemental|MM}, the hit is a critical hit.

This sword has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn. If it is submerged in a river or the sea at dawn, it regains all its charges instead. As an action while wielding this blade, you can expend a charge to strike the earth, sending a blast of power in a 30 foot wide, 90 foot long line. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 15 feet away from the center of the line and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. If the line passes through a body of water, the shockwave pushes the water aside, forming a 30-foot-wide trench. The trench remains until the end of your next turn, after which the water slowly flows back into place.

item.name: Braziers of Misty Forms
entries: Braziers of misty forms come in pairs, with each silver goblet marked with matching ripple patterns. While you are holding a brazier, you can speak its command word as an action. When you do so, any nonmagical liquid within the brazier instantly transforms into mist, spreading out around you in a 10-foot-radius sphere that lightly obscures the area for 1 minute. The mist takes on the form of each creature or object within 10 feet of the other brazier, moving and shifting as the shapes it represents does for the duration. The other brazier then also activates as if its command word had been spoken.
If the brazier is empty when you speak its command word, it does not produce a mist.
Once you use a brazier in this way, it can't be used again until the next dawn. If one of the braziers is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Bubble Barrier
entries: This fist-sized glass orb glistens iridescent in sunlight. When you take damage or are forced to make a saving throw against an effect that you can see, you can crush the orb as a reaction, destroying it and enveloping you in a protective bubble which functions as an {@spell Otiluke's resilient sphere|PHB}, preventing the triggering effect and lasting until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Captain's Lantern
entries: This exquisite brass-and-green glass lantern constantly protects the ship it is mounted on. Until it is removed, the entire ship is under the effect of the {@spell alarm} spell, set to produce the sound of heavy bronze bells ringing when triggered.

If you speak the lantern's command word while touching a copper coin to the underside of the lantern, the coin becomes a token of passage, marked with a depiction of the ship on one of its faces. While a creature is carrying a token, it does not trigger the lantern's alarm. If you speak the lantern's command word while holding a silver coin to the underside of the lantern, all previously created tokens of passage lose their magic and revert to nonmagical copper coins.

A creature that spends 1 minute studying the lantern can attempt to learn the lantern's command word with a successful {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. On a failed check, the {@spell alarm} spell triggers.

item.name: Cephalian Bands
entries: These brass armbands bear the shape of entwined tentacles, lined with veins of black ink. While wearing them, you have advantage on checks made to maintain grapples.

While you are underwater, you can use an action to cast {@spell darkness} from the bands, centered on yourself. When you do so, your speed is doubled until the end of the turn. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Crab Claw Gauntlets
entries: These spiked silver gauntlets resemble the claws of a giant crab.

While you are wearing these gauntlets, your unarmed strikes made with these claws deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier instead of their normal damage and gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike made with one of these claws, the creature is {@condition grappled} if the claw isn't already grappling another creature or holding an object.

item.name: Dragon Turtle Armor
entries: This fine turtle-shell armor constantly emits faint trails of steam. While wearing this armor, you gain a swim speed of 40 feet, have resistance to fire damage, and can breathe air and water.

While you are wearing the armor, you can use an action to cast {@spell burning hands} as a 3rd-level spell (save {@dc 15}) from the armor. When you cast the spell in this way, it produces a burst of steam instead of flames, and being underwater doesn't grant resistance against the spell's damage. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can roll a {@dice d6} at the start of each of your turns. On a 5 or 6, you regain the ability to cast the spell with this armor.

item.name: Figgly's Wand of Squids
entries: This jet black wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell Figgly's exploding squid|ABYSS} spell ({@hit 7} to hit) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand explodes in a burst of black ink and is destroyed.

item.name: Flow Gauntlets
entries: These gauntlets appear to be made out of mercury bound into a semi-solid shape, but become transparent when submerged in water. These gauntlets have 3 charges, and regain all expended charges daily at dawn. When you cast a spell that lacks the hydromancy tag while wearing these gauntlets, you can spend 1 charge to grant the spell the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet. When you cast a spell in this way, a watery hand appears at the chosen point, delivering the spell for you.

item.name: Fog Horn
entries: This silver horn 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell from it, producing a low drone audible out to 300 feet. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

item.name: Gold Fish
entries: This solid gold clockwork fish flops pathetically when it is within 120 feet of another piece of gold that is coin-sized or larger. If the fish is submerged, it instead swims toward the treasure at a rate of 10 feet per round.

item.name: Grail of Restoration
entries: This ornate alabaster grail can't be accidentally spilled. This grail has 20 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to drink from the grail or pour water from it on another creature's wounds, expending any number of charges from the grail. The target regains a number of hit points equal to the number of charges spent. Alternatively, you can expend 5 charges to cast {@spell lesser restoration}, or 20 charges to cast {@spell greater restoration} from the grail.
The grail regains all its charges by being refilled with water at a river or freshwater lake at the moment of dawn.

item.name: Helm of Hunger
entries: This finned iron helmet resembles the visage of a shark, and grants the wearer the beast's signature frenzied hunger. While you are wearing the helmet you automatically know the location of each creature within 300 feet of you that doesn't have all of its hit points.

Additionally, this helmet has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While you are wearing the helmet, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell polymorph} spell targeting yourself. When you cast the spell in this way, you can only become a {@creature reef shark|MM}, {@creature hunter shark|MM}, {@creature giant shark|MM}, or {@creature megalodon|ABYSS} obeying all of the spell's other rules.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This helmet is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. Removing the helmet fails to end the curse on you. While you are cursed, you require ten times as much food to sustain yourself each day.

item.name: Hydromancer's Trident
entries: This trident is carved with arcane channels that run its length, allowing it to transfer its movements through bodies of water. When you make an attack with this trident while you are standing within 5 feet of a body of water, you can choose a point within 30 feet of you that is within the same body of water. The attack is made as if you were at the chosen point, but you must use your own senses.

item.name: Knave's Cutlass
entries: This weapon is unusually light, and was crafted to be used by the most vicious of pirates. You can use this weapon while it is held between your teeth as if you were holding it in a hand. While you are holding the weapon in this way, your speech is somewhat impeded, and you can't cast spells that include a verbal component. When you make an attack as a bonus action using two-weapon fighting, you can make an additional attack with this weapon as part of the same bonus action. You must be wielding three separate one-handed melee weapons in order to make this additional attack, and you don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the additional attack, unless that modifier is negative.

item.name: Krend's Fishing Rod
entries: This fishing rod is tipped at the end with a jagged spear point, and is fitted with a magical lure. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can cast the lure out to a point within 10 feet of you. While the lure is floating within a body of water, you know the exact depth of the water directly underneath the lure. Additionally, when a submerged creature comes within 10 feet of the lure, you can cause the lure to shoot out toward it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or become ensnared by the lure. While ensnared, the target can't move more than 30 feet away from you. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success.
As an action, you can attach the lure to the butt end of the spear, allowing the fishing rod to function as a longbow.

item.name: Instrument of the Coxswain
entries: This musical instrument has 7 charges, and regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. You can use an action to start a performance, expending 1 charge from it to command obedience from each creature of your choice that can see and hear you within 120 feet. The performance lasts for up to 1 minute, and ends if you use your action to do anything else. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw using your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} by you until the performance ends. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature uses its action to sing and all its movement to dance. You can mentally command the creature to instead use its action and movement to perform strenuous or intense labor such as mining, cleaning, crafting, or cooking and serving food and drinks. If harmed by you or your companions, or commanded to do something that would be harmful to it, a target ceases to be {@condition charmed} in this way.
You can also use an action to play the instrument and expend 6 charges from it to cast the {@spell Otto's irresistible dance} spell from it, using your spell save DC.

item.name: Lifeline
entries: While held, 50-foot length of rope binds itself around your wrist. As an action, you can tether this rope to a creature within 20 feet of you. If you target an unwilling creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw to avoid being tethered. While tethered, the creature can't move more than 50 feet away from you. If an effect would move either you or the tethered creature more than 50 feet apart, the other is dragged along as well.

While you are tethered to a creature, both you and that creature have resistance to all damage. Each time either you or the tethered creature takes damage, the other takes the same amount of damage. Additionally, while either you or the tethered creature can breathe, the other can also breathe.

The rope is an object with with an AC of 15, 20 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. If the rope is reduced to 0 hit points, it is severed and can't be used again until the next dawn, at which time its segments knit back together. The rope is also severed if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 15} Strength check, or if an effect would ever cause you to have full cover from the tethered creature.

item.name: Lurelight
entries: This dangling, glowing orb ever draws eyes towards it. It emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. As an action while you are holding the orb, you can expand or reduce the radius of the bright and dim light by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.
A creature that can see the orb has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to perceive any creature not illuminated by the orb's light.

item.name: Mariner's Cowl
entries: This cloak appears to be made of a translucent material that is perpetually covered by fresh dew. While wearing this cloak with its hood up, a fine mist fills your space, lightly obscuring you. You can see through this mist, as well as any fog, mist, or steam, both magical and nonmagical. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

While wearing the cloak, you can use your action to cast {@spell gaseous form} on yourself. When you cast the spell in this way, it doesn't require concentration, and you can use a bonus action on your turn to end the spell and revert to your normal form.

item.name: Mermaid's Sapphire
entries: This silver pendant bears a large sapphire, flanked by mermaids. While you are attuned to it, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can breathe water, and have a swim speed of 60 feet.

entries: When you leap out of water that is at least 10 feet deep, you can jump up to 20 feet.

items: You have {@sense blindsight} to a range of 60 feet while you are underwater and aren't {@condition deafened}.
If you move at least 30 feet in a straight line on your turn while you are underwater, attacks against you are made at disadvantage until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Necklace of Ocean Pearls
entries: This necklace has {@dice 1d6 + 3} pearls hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a pearl and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the pearl detonates as a 3rd-level {@spell aqueous blast|ABYSS} spell (save {@dc 15}).
You can hurl multiple pearls, or even the whole necklace, as one action. When you do so, increase the level of the {@spell aqueous blast|ABYSS} by 1 for each bead beyond the first.

item.name: Pearl of Lightning Absorption
entries: Shining with an impossible wet sheen, this silvery-white pearl from the Elemental Plane of Water has the ability to absorb and store lighting. When you take lightning damage while carrying this pearl, you can grant yourself resistance to the triggering lightning damage as a reaction, causing the pearl to gain 1 charge. If this brings the pearl's total number of charges above 10, the pearl explodes as if you had thrown it (see below). The pearl loses {@dice 1d4} stored charges daily at dawn.

As an action, you can throw the pearl at a point up to 60 feet away, causing it to shatter on impact. Each creature within 30 feet of that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d10} lightning damage for each charge in the pearl on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Pearl of Putrescence
entries: This flawless black pearl appears to be a {@item pearl of power|DMG} to anyone who tries to identify it, and can be used as one.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This pearl is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by the remove curse spell or similar magic. Removing the pearl fails to end the curse on you. Until the curse is broken, you don't regain spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Pipe of Bubbles
entries: This coral smoking pipe has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to speak a message of twenty-five words or less into the pipe, designating a creature you are familiar with. The pipe then forms a bubble, 1 inch in diameter. If the target isn't on the same plane of existence as you, the bubble bursts. Otherwise, the bubble begins drifting towards the target at a rate of 30 feet per round (3 miles an hour),  following the straightest possible path towards the target, while avoiding obstructions. If the bubble comes across an obstruction it can't avoid (such as a closed door between it and the target), it stops moving until there is a clear path to the target. When the bubble reaches the target, it bursts harmlessly against the target's ear, delivering the message to the target. The target (and only the target) can hear the message.
The bubble is a Tiny object with an AC of 5 and 1 hit point. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, it bursts. At the end of each hour it has traveled, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the bubble bursts.

item.name: Potion of Blooming Coral
entries: When you drink this potion, coral formations rapidly form over the surface of your skin, lasting for 1 hour. For the duration, your AC can't be less than 16, and you emit an {@condition invisible} aura around you in a 10 foot radius around you. Spells of 3rd level or lower can't affect creatures or objects within the radius, and the area within the radius is excluded from areas affected by such spells.

When you first drink the potion, you must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by the coral for the duration. While you are {@condition restrained} by the coral, you must repeat the Constitution saving throw at the start of each of your turns. If you fail the saving throw against this potion three times, you become {@condition petrified} for the duration. If you succeed on the saving throw three times, you are no longer {@condition restrained}. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until you collects three of a kind.
This potion's sea-green liquid contains flakes of vibrant coral suspended within it.

item.name: Potion of Icy Veins
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the {@spell armor of Agathys} spell at the start of each of your turns for 1 hour. The potion's pale blue fluid is sparkles with iridescent ice crystals.

item.name: Prismatic Polyp
entries: You can use an action to throw this colorful coral bud at a point within 60 feet of you, which shatters on impact and is destroyed. Each creature within 5 feet of the point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} piercing damage. Colourful entangling coral then spreads along solid surfaces in a 15-foot radius around the point, becoming difficult terrain until cleared. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels. Each 5-foot-square portion of the coral requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

item.name: Quiver of the Kraken
entries: This magic quiver is imbued with the power of a mighty kraken, and has three compartments. The large first compartment can hold up to 10 pieces of ammunition. The smaller second and third smaller compartments can each hold up to 5 pieces of ammunition. Every day at dawn, the quiver imbues each piece of nonmagical ammunition in the first compartment with the Binding Tentacles property, the second compartment with the Lightning properties, and the third compartment with the Ink Cloud property.
Once a piece of ammunition drawn from this quiver has been used, the ammunition is destroyed.

entries.name: Binding Tentacles
entries: This piece of ammunition transforms into a mass of tentacles when you make an attack with it. If the attack hit a creature, it suffers the attack's normal effects and becomes {@condition restrained} by the tentacles for 1 minute, after which the tentacles vanish. A creature {@condition restrained} by the tentacles can use its action to make a {@dc 17} Strength check. On a success, it frees itself, destroying the tentacles.

entries.name: Ink Cloud
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of ammunition, which releases wisps of poisonous ink when you make an attack with it. Hit or miss, the ammunition bursts into an ink cloud in a 60 foot radius around the target. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. A strong current disperses the cloud, which otherwise disappears at the end of your next turn. Each creature that ends its turn in the area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Lightning
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of ammunition, which arcs with lightning when you make an attack with it and deals an additional {@damage 4d10} lightning damage to a creature it hits.

item.name: Rayleigh's Raincoat
entries: This knee-length coat is imbued with absorptive magic, and can be worn over normal clothing or light armor. When it comes into contact with at least 1 gallon of water, the coat's weight magically increases to 60 pounds, and it functions as a suit of splint armor (AC 17). You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor. If the coat is left to dry for 1 minute, it reverts to normal.

item.name: Rhelmon's Anchor
entries: This weapon takes the form of a heavy iron anchor, pitted and worn through time, attached to a 30-foot-long iron chain. While you are attuned to the weapon, its chain is bound to the wrist of your dominant hand, and it can't ever be moved more than 30 feet away from you. If an effect would move either you or the weapon more than 30 feet away from each other, the other is dragged along as well.
You gain a +2 to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the thrown property with a normal range of 10 feet and a long range of 30 feet.

Immediately after making a ranged attack with this weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to reel the weapon back to your hand. The target of the attack must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is dragged up to 10 feet toward you if it is Large or smaller, or knocked {@condition prone} if it is Huge or larger.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This maul is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, the weapon's chain binding it to you can't be removed, and you have disadvantage on attack rolls with weapons other than this one.

Rhelmon's anchor is a weapon of supernatural density, weighing 100 pounds. If you have a Strength score below 17, your movement speed is reduced by 20 feet and you have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws that use Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution while the weapon is bound to you.

item.name: Ring of the Hagfish
entries: This silver ring in the shape of a hagfish is constantly slick with a thin layer of mucus. While you are attuned to this magic item, you have a swim speed of 30 feet, can breathe underwater, are immune to acid damage, and can't be {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}.

As an action, you can summon a Huge {@creature gelatinous cube|MM}, which appears centered in your space. Its statistics other than its size are unchanged. Each creature that would be inside the cube's space when it first appears can make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer engulfed by the cube.

The cube disappears after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 hit points. It is friendly to you and your companions, and has its own turn on your initiative count. You can use a bonus action to command how the cube moves and what action it takes on its next turn, or to give it general orders, such as to attack your enemies. Otherwise, the cube acts in accordance with its normal disposition and alignment. After summoning a cube this way, you can't summon another until the next dawn.

item.name: Sea Devil's Sapphire
entries: This silver pendant bears a small sapphire surrounded by all manner of strange and terrifying creatures. While wearing it, you can expend 1 charge as an action to speak this pendant's command word, granting yourself the terrifying visage of a devil for 1 minute. If a creature that isn't a fiend or undead starts its turn within 30 feet of you and can see you, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see you until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

While {@condition frightened}, the creature is {@condition paralyzed}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the pendant's effect for the next 24 hours. Once used, this pendant can't be used again until the next dawn

entries.name: Curse
entries: The pendant is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by the remove curse spell, a dispel evil and good spell, or similar magic. Removing the pendant fails to end the curse on you. While cursed, you have a swim speed of 0 and sink 60 feet at the start of your turn if you are in water.

item.name: Sea Walker's Helm
entries: This piece of headgear is cobbled together from the chitin and gills of a giant crab. It remains constantly damp with briny water, and never rots. While wearing this helm, you can walk and act on surfaces underwater as if on dry land, regardless of orientation, and the amount of time you can hold your breath is doubled.

item.name: Shape of Water
entries: This holy water within this flask can be willed into the shape of a beast. While you are attuned to the flask, you can perform a 1 hour ritual to cast the {@spell find familiar} spell, forming the familiar formed by the water in the flask. The familiar is an elemental instead of a beast, is {@condition invisible} while submerged in a body of water, and can use its action to change forms into another creature listed in the find familiar spell.

If the familiar is reduced to 0 hit points or your attunement with the flask ends, the familiar becomes a normal puddle of water. The flask must then be refilled with 1 pint of holy water before it can be used to cast the spell again in this way.

item.name: Shield of Surfing
entries: This shield functions as a mundane shield until you place it upon the surface of a liquid and speak its command word. It then can be ridden over the surface of the liquid. The shield has a speed of 50 feet. It can carry 400 pounds, but its speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The shield sinks if its carrying more than 400 pounds, and stops floating when held.

On your turn, you can expend 10 feet of movement to attempt a {@dc 10} Dexterity check to perform a stunt with the shield, such as a flip or a spin. If the check is successful, you perform the stunt and gain a bonus to AC as if  holding the shield until the end of your turn. If the check fails by 5 or more, you and all creatures riding on the shield immediately fall {@condition prone} as the shield wipes out and comes to a dead stop.

item.name: Ship in a Bottle
entries: This glass bottle contains a miniature ship within it, which glows faintly when within 120 feet of the sea. You can use an action to throw this bottle up to 60 feet away. The bottle shatters on impact with a body of water, releasing a ghostly ship as a 7th-level {@spell phantom galley|ABYSS} spell (save {@dc 17}).

item.name: Soulbound Wheel
entries: This ornately carved wheel harbors the soul and of an experienced mariner. The wheel is affixed to a ship with a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity check using carpenter's tools made over the course of 1 hour, binding the soul to the ship.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The wheel is a sentient magic item with an Intelligence of 13, a Wisdom of 17, and a Charisma of 13. It retains the same alignment of the soul bound to it in life. The wheel has hearing and {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet, and can see normally beyond this range.
The wheel can speak, read, and understand Common, and can communicate telepathically with any creature within 120 feet of it, with the same voice it had in life.

While it is bound to a ship, the wheel can steer and navigate the ship automatically. When it makes a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check pertaining to navigating the open seas, it makes the check with a bonus of +7.

entries.name: Personality
entries: The wheel is gruff and abrasive. With such a vast wealth of knowledge pertaining to the seas, ships, and navigation, it tends to butt words with those it perceives as being unworthy of command. To earn the wheel's respect, a captain must demonstrate powerful command, as well as both the respect of their crew and a deep compassion for them.

item.name: Spellguard Staff
entries: This staff is formed from vibrant coral and imbued with defensive enchantments. It can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

The staff has 10 charges, and regains {@dice 1d8 + 2} charges daily at dawn. You can use your reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you is targeted by a spell or magical effect to expend up to 5 charges from the staff. The target gains a number of temporary hit points equal to five times the number of expended charges. While a creature has these hit points, it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks have disadvantage against it. These hit points are applied to the target before the effects of the spell or magical effect targeting it.

item.name: Sticky Shield
entries: This shield's face is covered with a sticky substance which allows it to bind to anything it touches. When a creature that is no more than one size larger than you misses you with a melee attack while you are holding this shield, you can use your reaction to attempt to catch the weapon against the shield's face. The attacker must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the weapon becomes stuck to the shield. If the weapon's wielder can't or won't let go to the weapon (such as if it missed with a natural weapon or unarmed strike), the wielder is {@condition grappled} while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon can't be used. A creature can attempt to pull the weapon free by using an action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check, freeing it on a success.

item.name: Storm Cleaver
entries: This ancient sword is imbued with energy from the Elemental Plane of Air, and is capable of manifesting the power of storms.When drawn, it produces a gentle wind which swirls around its blade.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While you hold the sword, you have resistance to thunder damage, and you can cleave the air as an action to use one of the following additional properties. When one of these properties is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Air Slash
entries: You send a shockwave traveling in a line 60 foot long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The shockwave functions as a gust of strong wind, dispersing gas or vapor and extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area.

entries.name: Cleave Clouds
entries: You send a wide arc of wind high into the sky, dispersing any clouds in a 1 mile radius directly above you.

entries.name: Uplifting Gale
entries: You create a blast of wind beneath your feet. You can fly up to 60 feet in any direction and make one melee attack with this sword. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks, and the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage for every 10 feet you moved toward the target as part of this action.

entries.name: Whirlwind
entries: You create a vortex of wind that fills a 20 foot radius centered on you. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is pulled or pushed up to 10 feet towards or away from you. You choose whether the whirlwind pushes or pulls when you create it.

item.name: Supreme Soaker
entries: The supreme soaker is a uniquely designed ranged weapon, consisting of a series of three flasks held within an external backpack, which is hooked up to a barrel through which liquid can be expelled. It also has a grip, for ease of use, and a trigger that can be pressed to activate the weapon. You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which has the heavy and two-handed weapon properties, and its attacks have a range of 100/400 feet. Creatures proficient with heavy crossbows are also proficient with this weapon.

The weapon uses liquid as ammunition. Liquid can be loaded into each of the weapon's three flasks, which can each magically hold up to 10 gallons (80 pints) despite their small size. You can switch which flask the weapon draws from as a bonus action.

Making an attack with this weapon consumes 1 pint of liquid. The weapon deals {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage on a hit, and magically soaks the target until the start of your next turn. A soaked creature has its speed reduced by 10 feet, and has disadvantage on Dexterity ability checks.
If the weapon is loaded with a any of the following liquids, it has additional effects, depending on the type of liquid:

entries.name: Acid
entries: On a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 6d6} acid damage.

entries.name: Holy Water
entries: A fiend or undead takes {@dice 2d6} additional radiant damage on a hit. While soaked in holy water, a target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius.

entries.name: Oil
entries: If a target soaked in oil takes fire damage, it takes an additional 5 fire damage from the oil burning away. Afterwards, the creature is no longer soaked.

item.name: Tide Inheritor's Conch
entries: This Large conch shell shines iridescent in the light, weighing 300 pounds. As an action, you can make a {@dc 15} Constitution check to blow the conch. A Huge or larger creature automatically succeeds on this check. On a success, a deep drone fills the air. Each beast and humanoid that can hear the conch within 300 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute.

While a humanoid is {@condition charmed} by the conch, it regards you and your possessions as magnificently beautiful, and takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can. While a beast is {@condition charmed} by the conch, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "{@action Attack} that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

Each time you or your companions do anything harmful to a {@condition charmed} target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the conch's effects for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Tranquil Anchor
entries: This anchor-shaped iron pendant seems completely stationary, never swaying or shaking even in defiance of its wearer's movements. While wearing this pendant, you can't be moved against your will, and can't be teleported or transported to other planes against your will, such as by the teleport or banishment spells.

item.name: Treasure Map, Uncommon
entries: Promising a vast fortune, this scroll bears upon it a map with a particular location marked with a glowing red cross. By using an action to read the scroll's command word, you can cause the scroll to conjure forth its treasure in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. You must be standing in the marked location when you use the scroll, or the treasure will not appear. Once the scroll has manifested its treasure, it becomes a non- magical piece of parchment.
The contents of the Uncommon Treasure Map's horde are determined by rolling on the {@table Treasure Hoard: Challenge 0—4|DMG} table.

item.name: Treasure Map, Rare
entries: Promising a vast fortune, this scroll bears upon it a map with a particular location marked with a glowing red cross. By using an action to read the scroll's command word, you can cause the scroll to conjure forth its treasure in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. You must be standing in the marked location when you use the scroll, or the treasure will not appear. Once the scroll has manifested its treasure, it becomes a non- magical piece of parchment.
The contents of the Rare Treasure Map's horde are determined by rolling on the {@table Treasure Hoard: Challenge 5—10|DMG} table.

item.name: Treasure Map, Very Rare
entries: Promising a vast fortune, this scroll bears upon it a map with a particular location marked with a glowing red cross. By using an action to read the scroll's command word, you can cause the scroll to conjure forth its treasure in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. You must be standing in the marked location when you use the scroll, or the treasure will not appear. Once the scroll has manifested its treasure, it becomes a non- magical piece of parchment.
The contents of the Very Rare Treasure Map's horde are determined by rolling on the {@table Treasure Hoard: Challenge 11—16|DMG} table.

item.name: Treasure Map, Legendary
entries: Promising a vast fortune, this scroll bears upon it a map with a particular location marked with a glowing red cross. By using an action to read the scroll's command word, you can cause the scroll to conjure forth its treasure in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. You must be standing in the marked location when you use the scroll, or the treasure will not appear. Once the scroll has manifested its treasure, it becomes a non- magical piece of parchment.
The contents of the Legendary Treasure Map's horde are determined by rolling on the {@table Treasure Hoard: Challenge 17+|DMG} table.

item.name: Tome of the Deep Sea
entries: The cover of this ancient spellbook is made from seaweed, and its pages are constantly damp.
This spellbook, along with anything written on its pages, can't be damaged by immersion in water. A newly discovered spellbook contains the following spells:

rows: {@spell meandering torrent|ABYSS}, {@spell portal to the depths|abyss}
{@spell carve gulf|ABYSS}, {@spell echoes of the deep|abyss}

entries: These spells are wizard spells for you.

entries.name: Font of Seawater
entries: You can use an action to open the spellbook and speak one of its command words to cause the spellbook to produce 10 gallons of seawater, which pours from its pages as if from an overflowing basin. The spellbook continues to produce sea water at the same rate at the start of each of your turns until it is closed (100 gallons per minute or 6,000 gallons per hour), up to a maximum of 144,000 gallons over 24 hours.

Once the spellbook has produced 144,000 gallons of water, its pages turn bone-dry and it can't be used in this way again until it has been submerged in seawater for 24 hours. During this time, the spellbook absorbs seawater at a rate of 10 gallons per turn at the start of each of your turns (100 gallons per minute or 6,000 gallons per hour), up to a maximum of 144,000 gallons of water over 24 hours.

entries.name: Ocean Codex
entries: You can use your action to open the spellbook and speak one of its command words, naming a creature, loca- tion, or object, to search the spellbook for information. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the spellbook magically displays information about the creature, location, or object within its pages. This information is limited to subject matter associated with the ocean, and may not be complete. Once you have used the spellbook in this way, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Summons of the Sea
entries: You can use an action to open the spellbook and speak one of its command words to conjure a creature, which appears within a body of water you can see within 30 feet of you. Roll a {@dice d100} and consult the table to determine which creature appears. If there isn't enough space for the creature within the body of water, it fails to manifest.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions, and obeys your commands. It vanishes after 1 hour or if it is reduced to 0 hit points.
Once you use the spellbook in this way, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Vitreous Tear
entries: This glassy pendant, hung from kelp thread, never quite dries. While wearing this pendant while you are underwater, you can use your action to become {@condition invisible} until you move or take an action or a reaction.

item.name: Wand of Phase Change
entries: The wand has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to produce one of the following effects in a 5 foot radius centered on a point you can see within 30 feet of you.

entries.name: Condense
entries: Any nonmagical fog, mist, or steam within the area condenses into water.

entries.name: Freeze
entries: Any nonmagical water within the area freezes into ice. If a creature is submerged in the water, it must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} within the ice. A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 bludgeoning or fire damage to the ice (AC 13) destroys the ice, freeing the creature without harming it. The surface of the ice is slick and slippery, and functions as a {@spell grease} spell (DC 13) until it is destroyed.

entries.name: Melt
entries: Any nonmagical ice within the area melts into water.

entries.name: Vaporize
entries: Any nonmagical water within the area evaporates into steam, which heavily obscures the area. The steam lasts until the start of your next turn before dispersing, or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

item.name: War Rigging
entries: The enchantments placed upon this collection of heavy ropes and canvas sails makes it impossible for them to be set ablaze by any means, nonmagical or magical.
An individual piece of rope or fabric separated from the whole loses its magic, but rope or fabric used to repair the rigging gains the enchantment's benefits.

itemGroup.name: Treasure Map
entries: Promising a vast fortune, this scroll bears upon it a map with a particular location marked with a glowing red cross. By using an action to read the scroll's command word, you can cause the scroll to conjure forth its treasure in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. You must be standing in the marked location when you use the scroll, or the treasure will not appear. Once the scroll has manifested its treasure, it becomes a non- magical piece of parchment. The DM chooses the treasure or determines it randomly, which also determines the scroll's rarity.

rows: Roll on the {@table Treasure Hoard: Challenge 0—4} table
Roll on the {@table Treasure Hoard: Challenge 5—10|DMG} table
Roll on the {@table Treasure Hoard: Challenge 11—16|DMG} table
Roll on the {@table Treasure Hoard: Challenge 17+|DMG} table

entries: This pale white blade is constructed entirely from a single crystal of salt. You gain a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This sword has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can use your action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell salt spray|ABYSS} spell (save DC 15) from it. Additionally, when you attack a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you can cause the weapon to release a blast of saltwater, which destroys any nonmagical armor made of metal that the target is wearing.
