A fishbone blade is a sword crafted in form of a fish's skeleton, and functions as a dancing sword. Attacks made with this weapon don't suffer disadvantage from being underwater.
When you speak the sword's command word to cause it to hover, it provides additional benefits while it is submerged in water, as specified in the sword's description.

entries.name: Master's Marlin
entries: When the sword deals damage to a creature, you gain advantage on the next attack you make against it before the end of the turn.

entries.name: Sage's Salmon
entries: When the sword deals damage to a creature, it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of the turn.

entries.name: Surgeon's Sturgeon
entries: You can use a bonus action to cause the sword to fly up to 30 feet to another spot within 30 feet of you and stabilize an {@condition unconscious} creature within 5 feet of it.
This magic bow is formed of silver, laced with veins of icy blue, and creates ammunition by freezing the water in the air into arrows or bolts.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon, you can create one piece of magic ammunition from water within an open container within 5 feet of you. The ammunition created by the weapon melts after it hits or misses a target. When you create ammunition for the weapon in this way, you ignore the weapon's loading property, if it has it.

This weapon has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. When you make a ranged attack made with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge from the weapon to cast {@spell fog cloud}, centered on the target of the attack. When the spell is cast in this way, it doesn't require concentration.

entries.name: Surgeon's Sturgeon
entries: This savage blade is consists of shark's teeth bound to a staff of coral and decorated with pearls.

A number of the shark-tooth blade's teeth (typically {@dice 1d4}) are marked with runes. The first rune always grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Each rune beyond the first grants the shark-tooth blade an additional property. The DM chooses each property or determines it randomly on the Shark-Tooth Blade Properties table.

You can perform a 1 hour ritual to etch a new rune into one of the blade's teeth, using the blood of a sea creature of CR 10 or higher killed within the past 1 hour. For each rune the blade possesses, the minimum CR required increases by 1.

entries.caption: Shark-Tooth Blade Properties
rows: Increase the bonus to attack and damage rolls by 1, to a maximum of +3. Reroll if the shark-tooth blade already has a +3 bonus.

You can use an action to cast one 1st-level spell (chosen by the DM) from the sword (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks, +4 spellcasting ability modifier). After you cast the spell, you can't cast it again until the next dawn.

You can use an action to cast one 2nd-level spell (chosen by the DM) from the sword (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks, +4 spellcasting ability modifier). After you cast the spell, you can't cast it again until the next dawn.

You can use an action to cast one 3rd-level spell (chosen by the DM) from the sword (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks, +4 spellcasting ability modifier). After you cast the spell, you can't cast it again until the next dawn.
The shark-tooth blade can be used as a spellcasting focus, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells. Reroll if the shark-tooth blade already has a +3.
The shark-tooth blade gains the reach property.
The shark-tooth blade gains the finesse property.
The shark-tooth blade gains the heavy property.
The shark-tooth blade scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
Attack rolls made with the shark-tooth blade have advantage against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries: This magic weapon emits a cold mist, and is rimed over with small ice crystals. It has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend a charge to slam the ground or the surface of a body of water, causing sharp ice spikes to form in a line 60 foot wide and 20 foot wide, which last until the end of your next turn. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. If a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.
